item.title: The Neovim Introduction I Wish Read
item.author: jakob.kuelzer@gmail.com (Jakob Külzer)
item.description: I’ve been an avid user of vim for years and was happy with it. I spent a good amount of time setting up my vim configuration to my liking and even understood some of it. But then recently I felt compelled to give LLM agents a try and found avante.nvim highly recommended. Except it’s a Neovim plugin. So far I’ve been pretty indifferent towards Neovim but this was enough of a motivator to give it a try. Hubris and how-hard-can-it-be thinking got the better of me and I set out to create a blank init.lua. I learned a lot about how Neovim works. This post is a collection of fundamentals that are obvious in hindsight but irritating and surprising to figure out as a beginner.
